meanings.definition: To remove military forces from an area.
meanings.sent1: The peace treaty will demilitarize the border between the two countries.
meanings.sent2: The government decided to demilitarize the disputed region to promote peace.
meanings.sent3: The demilitarization of the island led to a surge in tourism.
meanings.sent4: She demilitarized her room by removing all the toy soldiers.
meanings.sent5: The general's order to demilitarize the area was met with relief by the local residents.

meanings.definition: To make a military organization less powerful or aggressive.
meanings.sent1: The new policies aim to demilitarize the army and focus on humanitarian efforts.
meanings.sent2: The president's decision to demilitarize the police force was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent3: The demilitarized approach to negotiations helped in reaching a peaceful resolution.
meanings.sent4: She demilitarizes her language to avoid escalating the argument.
meanings.sent5: The coach's strategy was to demilitarize the team's tactics and focus on teamwork instead.
